Record_string.unknown_.description: Construct a type with a set of properties K of type T

Record_string.string_.description: Construct a type with a set of properties K of type T

Record_string.string-or-string-Array_.description: Construct a type with a set of properties K of type T

work_timeframe.description: Work time period. The value is UNIX time in seconds from epoch.

impact_timeframe.description: Impact time period. The value is UNIX time in seconds from epoch.

HypercertMetadata.description: Claim data for hypercert. ERC1155 Metadata compliant

name.description: Identifies the asset to which this token represents

description.description: Describes the asset to which this token represents

external_url.description: An url pointing to the external website of the project

image.description: A URI pointing to a resource with mime type image/* representing the asset to which this token represents. Consider making any images at a width between 320 and 1080 pixels and aspect ratio between 1.91:1 and 4:5 inclusive.

version.description: The version of Hypercert schema used to describe this hypercert

ref.description: Describes the asset to which this token represents

allowList.description: A CID pointer to the merke tree proof json on ipfs

Pick_EOACreateOrderRequest.Exclude_keyof.description: From T, pick a set of properties whose keys are in the union K

Omit_EOACreateOrderRequest.type_.description: Construct a type with the properties of T except for those in type K.

info.title: Hypercerts API
info.description: API for uploading allow lists and hypercert metadata. Visit /graphql for the GraphQL API.

post.description: Upload one or more files to IPFS storage.

files.description: - Array of files to upload (max 5 files, 10MB each)

jsonData.description: - Optional JSON string with additional metadata

post.description:
Submits a new hypercert metadata object for validation and storage on IPFS.
When an allowlist URI is provided the service will validate the allowlist data before storing the metadata.
Note that this might lead to a race condition when uploading metadata and the allowlist separately in rapid succession.
In that case we recommend using POST /metadata/with-allowlist instead.

requestBody.description: The metadata object to be stored.

schema.description: The metadata object to be stored.

errors.metadata: Allowlist URI already present in metadata.

post.description:
Submits a new hypercert metadata object paired with allowlist data for validation and storage on IPFS.
The service will parse and validate the allow list data and the metadata.
After successful validation, the allow list data will be uploaded to IPFS and the URI of the allowlist will be attached to the hypercert metadata.
If an allow list URI is already present, the service will return an error.

requestBody.description: The metadata object and allowlist data to be stored.

schema.description: The metadata object and allowlist data to be stored.

post.description: Validates a hypercert metadata object. When an allowlist URI is provided the service will validate the allowlist data as well.

requestBody.description: - The metadata object to be validated.

schema.description: - The metadata object to be validated.

post.description: Validates a hypercert metadata object paired with allowlist data.

requestBody.description: - The metadata object and allowlist data to be validated.

schema.description: - The metadata object and allowlist data to be validated.

post.description:
Submits a new order for validation and storage on the database.

For backwards compatibility, the old v1 order format is also supported. (Example 3)

value.message: Order nonce could not be updated

post.description: Updates and returns the order nonce for a user on a specific chain.
Validates an order and marks it as invalid if validation fails.
Create a new hyperboard. Creates the collections passed to it automatically.

Submits a new allowlist for validation and storage on IPFS. While we maintain a database of allowlists, the allowlist itself is stored on IPFS.
Try to keep a backup of the allowlist for recovery purposes.

Provide the dump of the OpenZeppelin MerkleTree and the total units.

Submits a new allowlist for validation.

Provide the dump of the OpenZeppelin MerkleTree and the total units.
